channel.title: SevenAtSevenPolitics
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from SevenAtSevenPolitics, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: How I Started A Private Library When My Public Library Ditched The Classics
item.description: The private library movement is growing around the English-speaking world, as public libraries ditch worthwhile classics.

item.title: It’s Time to Rein In Nationwide Injunctions
item.description: The Supreme Court can help restrain excessive nationwide injunctions, but only Congress can fix the problem at its roots.

item.description: The CCP is actively recruiting or coercing Chinese students and scholars at Stanford to serve as non-traditional intelligence assets.

item.title: White House says Trump 'trusts his physicians' following Biden's cancer announcement
item.description: President Donald Trump trusts White House doctors despite Biden's prostate cancer diagnosis, amid speculation that they may have missed it.

item.title: The Ongoing Failure Of Affirmative Action

item.description: It is time for the WHO to take a more pragmatic and inclusive approach — one that puts public health above politics.

item.title: Parent groups are hosting fairs that showcase phones with limited features to try and keep children away from smartphones
item.description: The fairs, where “dumb” or restricted phones are exhibited to parents, have been popping up around the U.S.
